fields.description:
h3. Symptom
The application navigator (top-left 'hotdog' drop-down menu) is missing entirely or items from it are missing, causing users to be unable to navigate through other products.

h3. Workaround
Contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com], who can disable and re-enable the "Atlassian Navigation Links Plugin" JIRA system plugin to resolve this issue. After it has been re-enabled, the menu should show as normal within one minute.
fields.summary: Application navigator missing entries or gone entirely, users unable to navigate to other products

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
It would be a great feature to have the "The Scheduler" plugin available for ondemand:

https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/pl.com.tt.jira.plugin.theschedulerpro
fields.summary: Bundle the "The Scheduler" plugin on OnDemand

fields.description:
When JIRA is starting up it needs to communicate with Crowd, which it currently does via Apache.

If all of Apache's workers are occupied with pending requests that are waiting for JIRA to come up, JIRA cannot talk to Crowd and cannot finish starting up. This results in a system-wide deadlock.

For this kind of critical inter-app communication, we need it to happen in such a way that it cannot be blocked, even when Apache's workers are all occupied with pending user requests.
fields.summary: System deadlock when all Apache workers are busy

fields.description: Recently I experimented with using Nginx's Proxy module and OnDemand. I found that while it works, I can't login. Since I think I have seen support for this on non-AOD JIRA instances, I have concluded it must have to do with the way the AOD Identification system works. I don't see a security issue with Proxy's going to AOD, but I don't know all about it.
fields.summary: Custom URLs through HTTP proxy

fields.description:
When a customer is creating a support ticket, at least, a suggestion/preferable SEN number and instance's URL should be automatic populated on the corresponding fields on the creation issue screen.
Leaving, as well, the option for the customer to change these values, if it owns more than one product, and also presents a drop-down list of recently used SEN numbers and instance's URLs for easy selection, in case the first suggestion/pre-populated one is not the desired one for the current ticket.

Just like the customer's timezone is automatic populated.

fields.description:
h3. Navigating and loading pages is *VERY SLOW*.

All screens are slow (several seconds), but the JIRA dashboard deserves a special sneak mention (over 10s sometimes!)

I'm wondering why (?) (?) (?)
* Could the slow loading be linked to the remoteness of Switzerland to Atlassian's Data Center ? I yes do you plan to open a server in Europe ?
* Our small team has only a few hundreds issues so querying the database should hardly cause any delay, except Atlassian uses a common database for all accounts ? 

The slowness of OnDemand is a major cause for poor adoption by the users. It's a pity because the usability has improved a lot these last 6 month. Congratulation for the new features in V6.0 (y) but plz do something to improve the speed so we can enjoy the new features and not constantly wait (n) for the web app to response.
fields.summary: Improve response time

fields.description:
h1. The Synopsis:

Cannot enable ZEN Intranet, which appears to be dependent on ZEN Foundation, which suffers the same disability.

h1. To Reproduce:

To reproduce, on a new confluence installation, Find Add-ons install ZEN Intranet ("FREE") Add-On. Select Manage and select Enable.

{panel:title=Error| titleBGColor=Red| bgColor=Red} 
This add-on failed to enable. It may require a license. Please refer to the logs for more information.
{panel}

Follow link to Marketplace, see and follow link dependency ZEN Foundation.

Download & Install Free Trial, apply license, Enable ZEN Foundation

{panel:title=Error| titleBGColor=Red| bgColor=Red} 
This add-on failed to enable. Your license may be invalid. Please refer to the logs for more information.
{panel}

h1. The Log

{noformat}
2013-04-20 18:23:02,527 ERROR [http-82-9] [atlassian.plugin.manager.PluginEnabler] actualEnable Unable to start the following plugins due to timeout while waiting for plugin to enable: com.zenfoundation.lightning.intranet
 -- referer: http://xxxxxxx:82/plugins/servlet/upm | url: /rest/plugins/1.0/com.zenfoundation.lightning.intranet-key | userName: xxxxxxx
2013-04-20 18:30:07,088 INFO [http-82-9] [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] notifyPluginDisabled Disabling com.zenfoundation
2013-04-20 18:30:07,088 ERROR [http-82-9] [atlassian.plugin.manager.PluginEnabler] actualEnable Unable to start the following plugins due to timeout while waiting for plugin to enable: com.zenfoundation
 -- referer: http://xxxxxxx:82/plugins/servlet/upm | url: /rest/plugins/1.0/com.zenfoundation-key | userName: xxxxxxx
{noformat}

h1. The Environment

* Windows server 2012 (64-bit)
* Oracle JAVA version 1.7.0_17 (64-bit)
* PostgreSQL version 9.2 (64-bit)
* Atlassian Confluence version 5.1.1 (64-bit)


h1. The Conclusion

Resulted frustration and blocking further progress evaluating the product. 

Should you require any further information please don't hesitate to holler.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 16/3/2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

Automatic backup scheduling IS on our list, although not in the very first horizon, as we are looking to completely overhaul the backup/restore experience.  Especially for those that have very large datasets.  With that said, there will be a mechanism available to automate this yourself, until we build that functionality into the UI. 

- https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Backup-Restore/gh-p/backupandrestore

Click the link, click request access, and we should get you in within 24 hours to review our strategy and provide feedback as we go. 
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Since we lost some data after a Confluence OnDemand upgrade but noticed the loss later than the 4 weeks, we would like to include the the Confluence backup into our local backup routines.

As I understand one has to manually create an export in the Backup Manager of JIRA and Confluence.
h3. Suggested Solution

Can you please add the possibility to automatic generate a backup each day or at least each week?
h3. Workaround

(!) The below backup scripts are working (at this current point in time) but the endpoints might change without notice: (!)
 * [https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/automatic-cloud-backup/src/master/]

Please be advised that you should avoid executing these backup scripts during [the maintenance window|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/maintenance-windows-744721660.html].

 

For more details on this, or for alternative ways to automate backups in Cloud, please refer to:
 - [How to Automate Backups for JIRA Cloud applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Automate+Backups+for+JIRA+Cloud+applications]
 - [Automate online site-backups for Jira and Confluence without programming|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Automate-online-site-backups-for-Jira-and-Confluence-without/ba-p/1271317]
fields.summary: Automatic Backup generation in Backup Manager

fields.description:
I'm using JIRA OnDemand and right now have an 1-10 account limit.  If I have someone help me out on a project and assign an issue to them, I cannot delete that user - and I will quickly run out of users in my account if someone decided to stop working with me or they are fired etc.

How is this supposed to work?  I hope you are not going to tell me that I have to go thru and unassign them from everything they've been assigned to, that's kind of ridiculous if there are a significant number of issues they dealt with  over the years.

fields.description:
Our documentation [Removing or Deactivating Users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Removing+or+Deactivating+Users] states:

{quote}
To deactivate a user:

    Go to the user's profile and choose Administer User.
    Choose Disable.
{quote}

And it shows a screenshot.

There is no option to disable a user on OnDemand. To do that, it is necessary to remove the users from every group and remove the [Application Access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Managing+application+access] of this user.

Also, the screenshot is from a screen that is not from Atlassian OnDemand.

Thanks!

Clarissa.
fields.summary: Please edit the documentation on Deactivating users

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

When the application URL and base URL for an application are not the same, the display URL should be used when creating links. For the application switcher, this is not being respected. This is not the same issue as CONF-22283, which is working fine.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Create an application link
# Change the display URL to something other than the application URL
# Click the application switcher at the top left of the page, and observe the link is not using the display url correctly

h4. Workaround

Recreate the application link, using the display URL as the application URL.
fields.summary: Display URL not respected in Application switcher

fields.description: When migrating from EHSP Onjira to OnDemand instance the disabled users in JIRA enterprise hosting will be imported as enabled users in OnDemand and their status will be "enabled". This is a potential data security risk in this case.
fields.summary: The JIRA migrator tool does not migrate disabled users correctly

fields.description: It would be awesome to get support for Azure in Atlassian OnDemand, since Azure serves different needs than Google Apps.
fields.summary: Support for Azure

fields.description: It would be great if there is a possibility to reset a particular application (eg: JIRA or Confluence) in OnDemand and not the entire instance.
fields.summary: Allow customers to reset a particular application and not the entire instance

fields.description:
Even users that do not have the primary domain as their account address are synched, but they can not log-in 
The reason is that on-demand uses an outdated login screen which prescribes the domain name (fixes it to the primary domain), instead of leaving the user enter the domain as it is now the standard for google apps.
So the current situation is 'broken' one way or another. Either such users should not be synchronized or the updated login dialog should be used.
fields.summary: OnDemand synchronizes all users in a multi domain GAPPS domain

fields.description:
Customers receive an error when trying to enable Gapps integration:

"Unfortunately we are unable to locate any active Google Apps enabled hosted instances associated with your domain."

\\
{panel:title=Workaround| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#ccc| titleBGColor=#F7D6C1| bgColor=#FFFFCE} 

Visit this link manually:
https://my.atlassian.com/googleAuth/domain?domainName=<gapps domain> - Be sure to add your Google Apps domain at the end of the URL.
{panel}

*This will be fixed on March 4 EST (Sydney).*
fields.summary: Error when trying to enable Google Apps integration: "Unfortunately we are unable to locate any active Google Apps ..."

fields.description:
Screenshot attached for reference. 

The link stated at the end of this paragraph:

Manage user access to applications by using the check box under each application. Giving a user access to an application means that the user will count towards that application's license. Application access is for licensing purposes only and does not restrict data or notifications for users. The data that users can see and the notifications they receive are determined by the permissions granted at the application level. *Learn more*.

Links to:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Managing+Permissions

The document in question is specific to Bamboo, resulting in customer confusion. The document should address all applications. It would seem at a minimum, that the link would cover project and issue permission and notification schemes. 

Cheers,
Jason | Atlassian
fields.summary: Application Access Screen > Info message includes hyperlink to Bamboo specific information

fields.description: Hereby find our request to be included as beta testers of the Plugin 3 feature. We are really interested in using this new feature as well as being able to use commercial plugins from the marketplace.
fields.summary: Request to participate in the Plugins 3 beta

fields.description:
https://aconex.jira.com
Version	6.0-OD-06
Build Number	6025
Build Date	Wed Jan 30 00:00:00 EST 2013
Build Revision	fd1db55a44a1ddbcf216516b895bbecb8d95821b

Fix version looks to be configured correctly and I was using it last week. This morning we started a new sprint and I found that I was unable to drag issues in greenhopper from one version to another.
I then found it was not editable inline, or in bulk and in the edit screen.  It was also not available when creating an issue.
fields.summary: The 'Fix Version/s' is no longer available in an existing issue to edit or when creating an issue

fields.description:
We have some trouble with the "resolution" field in Jira On Demand:

- After creating a new issue the field "resolution" is set to NULL which is represented in Jira with "unresolved" (italic style)
- Once we edit any other field of an issue, the field resolution is automatically set to the default resolution (e.g. "fixed")
- This is very annoying because here some piece of information is changed without our influence
- Some stats the display a confusing project status: The roadmap in the dashboard e.g. says "5 of 5 issues resolved" which is wrong because all issues are still open but got the resolution "fixed" which Jira uses to decline all issues to "done"

Why isn't it possible to simply remove a resolution? Why can't we set NULL/none as a value for resolution?

We really appreciate a hint or fix for that.
fields.summary: The resolution field cannot be set to NULL again after it has been filled once

fields.description: I am able to enable the Task Master add-on for JIRA (as part of your add-on beta program), but I am not allowed to "Find new Add-ons" within the Confluence administration page.  Why is my instance not allowed to access both?  I would really like to try out the Remote HTML plugin please.
fields.summary: Inconsistent Add-on Activation

fields.description:
When exporting a XML backup from JIRA OnDemand, it would be great if we have something like a checkbox where, when you select it, the export will come with the latest standalone supported version, by following the [Version matrix for imports|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+from+JIRA+OnDemand+to+a+JIRA+Installed+Site#MigratingfromJIRAOnDemandtoaJIRAInstalledSite-Versionmatrixforimports].

Sometimes, depending on the size of the backup, it's a pain to open it in a text editor and change the build number (as stated [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ONDEMANDKB/Importing+a+Project+from+JIRA+OnDemand+Backup+to+JIRA+Standalone+Edition+Fails+due+to+Newer+Version]) and we also have a quite few issues related to this specific case, a "failed restore due to newer versions".
fields.summary: Option to change the BUILD NUMBER when export a XML backup

fields.description: Test Description
fields.summary: Test

fields.description: As an admin, I'd like the option to control which application a project is created in OnDemand. Currently upon creating a project it will also create a Confluence space and FishEye project and so on, I'd like the ability or option to choose which applications to include or exclude in this option.
fields.summary: Ability to control which applications the project is created at in OnDemand

fields.description: Please :)
fields.summary: Unlink lezgro.atlassian.net from google apps

fields.description:
When I try to raise an issue to apply to be included in the next round of  Beta testers for OnDemand, (directly, from link in the documentation) I receive a permissions error.

The link is:
https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=12310&issuetype=16&summary=Feedback+on+Atlassian+Add-ons+Beta&priority=4&components=21190

Not sure if this is impacting other users
fields.summary: Beta Group Application Permissions

fields.description:
Before the recent Jira UI update, I could type a number (e.g., 2478) into the quick search box, and a list of the issues that matched that number would show below the quick search box.

Since the upgrade of the new UI, this no longer works.

Since I routinely work on multiple projects, it is a major pain to have to type in the full key plus number to find the issue that I'm looking for.

Can we get this functionality back?
fields.summary: Bring back the quick list of issues when an issue number is typed in to quick search

fields.description:
A customer has a self-hosted Bamboo instance with a properly valid SSL certificate (Safari reports "thawte Primary Root CA" -> "Thawte SSL CA" -> customer's cert, and both Chrome and Safari accept it) but when trying to set up applinks JIRA blows up with a "sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target" error.

Is there some way we can update the certs on all instances?
fields.summary: Update default cacerts

fields.description: Activity Stream on the homepage was updated a month ago or so and now includes irrelevant data from months ago instead of recent changes.  I think I should at least be able to customize this stream so I can see my team's latest updates easily and without navigating through to each individual project. thank you
fields.summary: Activity Stream displays out of date system updates
Update Gliffy plugin for Confluence

fields.description:
Reference Confluence OnDemand
site. contentserv.atlassian.net
Hi,

for business reason, we would like to offer a multiple user account for access to our Knowledge Base. It would be good if we could restrict access to the "Profile" for a user (in the Download version I believe one can!) and remove the rights to "People and Space Directory", again business results.
 
As Atlassian is not offering these restriction features in the OnDemand (please confirm!!), we have decided to use the anonymous access. This does not fit our business needs, but it appears that we have no other choice.
 
That having been said, this "anonymous" access does not appear to hide Confluence "Space" Administrator or Content creator names. The Space "Administrators" name is shown in the "Space Details" GUI and the anonymous user has access to "Extras", which includes the pages history. On the page history GUI, the content creator names are displayed. In both cases, an anonymous person has access to privilege information and can use it for abuse.
 
Also, an anonymous user appears to be able to create a "Blog", which does NOT make sense as the user is anonymous. These system settings appears to be encouraging trouble and abuse.
 
An anonymous user should not have rights to access user names nor create Blog content!!! 

Can you help us here? This is important as we may have to drop Confluence as our Knowledge Base source!
 
please let us know,
 
gerry
fields.summary: Conflunce "Anonymous User" can still see restricted information, user names and also,  post blogs

fields.summary: Inability to access Fisheye/Crucible - 500 server error

fields.description:
Per https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Automating+JIRA+Backups , in order to automate backups, I need to log in using our "global administrator" account. 

We seem to have lost the password for that account. How can I arrange to have it reset?

Thanks.
fields.summary: lost password for global administrator

fields.description:
If I view the summary page for a project and then click any link that takes me to  list of issues, it does not load properly in Firefox. It does load fully in Chrome. Tested with multiple FF and Chrome versions on Mac and Linux.

Up until last Saturday (Sydney, Australia time), everything worked well on Firefox. I have only noticed this when working this morning.

To give some specific links, if I visit this (our particular work version): https://sakurasky.atlassian.net/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=project+%3D+%22TO%22+AND+resolution+%3D+Unresolved+AND+     fixVersion+%3D+%22Sprint+9%22+ORDER+BY+priority+DESC&mode=hide

... I see the problem. It immediately gives an HTTP 302 redirect to /issues?jql=project....

In Chrome, this leads into a full page load (80-odd HTTP requests). In Firefox, it only makes 7 or so HTTP requests (see attached screenshot from Firebug output).

If I shift-reload the page (in Firefox), it loads /issues?... directly, rather than via the redirect and everything loads correctly. However, all links on the resulting page lead to the IssueNavigator.jspa link and we're off to redirect land and problems again.
fields.summary: Issue navigator page broken

fields.description: When migrating from EHSP OnConfluence to OnDemand instance the disabled users in Confluence enterprise hosting will be imported as enabled users in OnDemand and their status will be "enabled". This is a potential data security risk in this case.
fields.summary: The Confluence migrator tool does not migrate disabled users correctly

fields.description:
The current option to disable the Logout confimation doesn't work in OnDemand.

Users sometimes forget to completely logout of JIRA due to the logout confirmation window. This poses some potential security risks with users thinking they have logged out, but actually haven't. Disabling logout confirmation would solve this problem.
fields.summary: As a OnDemand Admin I would like to remove the logout confirmation from users.

fields.description:
The repo I would like to link using the plug-in is a repo that's private to an "Organization". 

I can't seem to get it to show up. 

I searched around a bit before I submitted this, and I saw:

https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/BBC-219

Similar issue? Has it been addressed for OnDemand?

Screenshot to follow.

Thanks.
fields.summary: DVCS does not seem to support github private repos owned by "Organization"s

fields.description:
I want to grant read only access to internal staff to our JIRA system as they had in Bugzilla. They should be able to view issues without needing to log on but they should NOT be able to make any changes.
When I enable the Browse Projects permission it allows users to access JIRA which is great, but they are able to update issues. I was able to verify an issue.
I expected Browse access to only grant Read Only access.

Either the name of the permission should be changed ("Access Project" perhaps) or, ideally, the access should be to Browse but not make any changes.


*Update*

I think I have found the problem. There were no Conditions or Validators on the workflow we were using. I still don't think this is the correct default behaviour and that the system should be more secure unless the user decides to open it up.
Now that there are Conditions on the workflow it's not possible for an anonymous person to Verify one of our issues.
fields.summary: Anonymous users should have Read Only access

fields.description:
We should have the ability to hide, while in Confluence as an open documentation portal for anonymous users, links to the Jira instance, Fisheye instance and any other that can appear on the drop down application menu.
!pic.png!

Since anonymous users just need to see the documentation and not other parts of the project.
fields.summary: Ability to hide Jira/Fisheye/others from the application drop down menu while on Confluence as anonymous user

fields.description: Currently JIRA Importer in AOD only supports SQLite, would be feasible if it supports other databases format such as MySQL
fields.summary: As a user, I want to import the data from "Trac" in MySQL database format

fields.description: I am trying out Jira onDemand and so far I love it.  However, we do not only open source projects but also private projects.  Can our ondemand instance support public and private projects?
fields.summary: Public and Private Projects

fields.description: I have in Github my main account but under it I have 2 organizations.  I can only connect to 1 account with Jira when I would like to connect to all accounts.  Basically some organizations have open source projects and some private projects.  I really need the capability to synchronize with repositories that exist in the 3 organizations.  Is this possible?
fields.summary: Multiple github accounts

fields.description:
Currently the 'electric Charlie' maintenance shows very little useful information.

It would be good if we could add the following links on that page to:
- the [maintenance window page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Atlassian+OnDemand+maintenance+windows], so that customers can check if they're within maintenance,
- the [OnDemand Status page|http://www.atlassian.com/software/ondemand/status], so they can check if there's a major incident occurring, and
- the [@OnDemandStatus|http://twitter.com/OnDemandStatus] twitter account, so they can get more information on the nature of the incident (if applicable).

This would allow customers to sometimes find out the cause of an outage without the need to contact Support.
fields.summary: Add extra information to the OnDemand maintenance page

fields.description:
The accounting feature results in a tempo reporting view where it says "monthly budget". Due to the fact, that there is no limitation how to use the budget, we e.g. use it for a yearly account. So in our case there should be displayed "yearly budget".

To keep it more flexible it should only be displayed "account budget" or the account should get a kind of flag like "validity period" where you can choose from "day", "month", "quarter", "year".
fields.summary: The "monthly budget" should be renamed

fields.description: As per the Atlassian Answer's topic at https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/132263/is-there-an-incoming-links-macro-available-for-ondemand, customer would like to have a bundled macro to generate a list of links of pages which link _into_ the current page.
fields.summary: Make Incoming-Links Macro Available in Confluence AOD

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Plugin: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.almworks.jira.plugin.jiraclient

The plugin is very simple - it only provides the site-wide licensing capacity for the JIRA Client application. Source code is available upon request.

We have a number of customers who use JIRA Client with JIRA OnDemand. They typically have to get a team license from ALM Works, but purchasing a site license from Atlassian would be beneficial.

Additionally, this would also allow 10-user customers to use JIRA Client for $10, which is not possible right now.
fields.summary: Request to support JIRA Client plugin

fields.description:
In an AOD instance where FeCru is subscribed and JIRA is integrated with Stash, users will need to have application access to FeCru in order to see Source tabs.

This is restricting users that don't require access to FeCru but them to see Stash info in JIRA.

EDIT: This also affects instances that has no FishEye subscription and users won't be able to view the source tab at all.
fields.summary: Application access to FeCru is blocking valid users to see information from Stash

fields.description: SVN permission configuration takes too long to get in effect. Sometimes it took hours before the new configuration will be taken.
fields.summary: SVN permission configuration takes too long to get in effect

fields.description:
Scenario 1:

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a user in Jira OnDemand, Assign the correct application access.
2. Remove the "users" group from the account memberships
3. Try to login with the user

!membership.png!

!global-permission.png!

Result: The login page refreshes without any error.
This causes confusion for the customer as there is no indication what is wrong.

Scenario 2:

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a user in Jira OnDemand, Assign the correct application access.
2. Remove the "users" group from the account memberships
3. Place a gadget on the system dashboard that retrieves data from a project
3. Try to login with the user

Result: The login page refreshes with the following error; _*"This dashboard does not contain any gadgets or you do not have permission to view them. Perhaps you need to log in to see them."*_
Due to this error the customer starts troubleshooting project permissions.

Both scenarios are unclear and could be better communicated when this is wrong.
fields.summary: No error or misleading error when user does not have the "jira user" permission

fields.description: It is useful for the customers to have the AOD version displayed on the footer, otherwise they need to go to the System Information to get this information, and only Administrators users have access to it.
fields.summary: Add the AOD version on the footer

fields.description:
Email updates from OnDemand often reference 'your' OnDemand instance or product, but for someone with multiple OnDemand instances this is quite obtuse and it is not at all clear which instances are being referenced.

To allow administrators to action such updates effectively:

# Updates that refer to all instances MUST indicate that all instances are affected, and a specific link to the relevant instances COULD be included.
# Updates that refer to a specific instance SHOULD provided a link to that instance. This would benefit users with just one instance as well.
# Updates that apply to some of many instances managed by the one account MUST link to each instance affected; alternatively, send one email for each instance, with each instance clearly identified in the email.
fields.summary: Include hosted URL in email communications

fields.description:
When performing a workflow scheme switch from 1 custom workflow scheme to another custom workflow scheme, where both workflow schemes do not make use of the default issue statuses from the JIRA Workflow, brings up a Step 2 screen as provided in the screenshot.

As I see it, Step 2 is in place in order to map issues to a status in the new workflow(scheme) since the one in the originating one is not present in the new one. When an issue has a status in the originating workflow(scheme) which is also available in the new one, it will not show up in this Step 2 screen.

When all statuses from the originating workflow(scheme) are available in the new one as well, Step 2 will display all issue types with the possible issue statuses from the JIRA Workflow, and explain it as if the JIRA Workflow is the current workflow of the project, whilst it isn't related to the project in any way. This is very confusing when trying to switch workflows. Please look into this.
fields.summary: Step 2 in Workflow scheme switcher extremely confusing

fields.description:

Thanks

fields.description: This just started happening on Monday 2013-01-07 as best we can tell. Commits are coming through with the wrong timestamps. This does not affect all commits, however, and is not consistent. Screenshot attached showing the date portion for reference.
fields.summary: Dates displayed for Bitbucket commits in JIRA activity stream are incorrect

fields.description:
In my commit messages, if I add an empty line before the JIRA command, JIRA never doesn't associate my commit with the issue. Here are a few examples

Commit 1: (will not work)
This is a test commit 

Updated feature A and feature B

JIRA-323 #resolve #time 3h


Commit 2: (works just fine)
This is a test commit 
Updated feature A and feature B
JIRA-323 #resolve #time 3h


This makes my commit messages really hard to read, and there is really no reason to miss a commit message because of newlines.
fields.summary: Github commit messages are missed if there is a newline just before JIRA DVCS command

fields.description:
Such feature used to be available in OnDemand, same as described on the following documentation:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Using+Google+Docs+with+Google+Apps+Integration#UsingGoogleDocswithGoogleAppsIntegration-AttachingGoogleDocstoissues

{quote}
# Create or open the desired JIRA issue.
# Click the 'Attach Google Docs' link. The 'Google Docs Picker' window appears. You can type text into the 'Title Contains' field to search for a document, also you can restrict the documents displayed by selecting an option from the 'Doc Type' drop-down menu. You can take a look at the contents of a document by clicking the 'preview' link next to each one.
To select the document(s) you want to attach, check the box next to the document file name and click 'Attach Selected Documents'.
# You will be returned to the view issue page. The attached documents will appear as a list in the 'Google Documents' section.
{quote}
fields.summary: Add the ability to attach Google Doc to issues

fields.description: Can not create any issues for the projects. Please find the attached screen grab.
fields.summary: Can not create any issues for project

fields.description:
Starting 27 Dec 2012 (GMT-8), many customers have received this stacktrace when trying to access admin functions or browse to GreenHopper:
{noformat}
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/postgresql/jdbc4/Jdbc4ParameterMetaData
    at org.postgresql.jdbc4.Jdbc4Statement.createParameterMetaData(Jdbc4Statement.java:46)
...
{noformat}

Also affects Confluence, creating a Comment will fail and pop up a red error box with a tracktrace with the same error.

Workaround: shut down the instance, wipe out the {{work}} and {{temp}} directories in the Tomcat directory ({{catalina-base}}) and start JIRA.  Need to file HOPS ticket to request that this be done during upgrades anyway.
fields.summary: Fireball-192 jdbc4 driver error in Tomcat due to caches
